text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so today I 
am making an awesome noodle dish called mee gati

now mee is short for sen mee which means a very 
thin rice noodles and gati is coconut milk so

it's a pink noodle dish with a coconut gravy 
on top it's so good and I like to call it the

creamy sister of Pad Thai because as you'll see 
there are a lot of elements that are very similar

between the two now it's been a long time since 
I've had this years and years so thank you Jason

from Malaysia for requesting this you reminded 
me how much I love it flip let's get started all

right so I'm going to start by making what I call 
the coconut gravy so I'm going to add some of my

coconut milk just a little bit into this pot here 
and now I'm just going to let it reduce until it's

really really thick so once the coconut milk is 
reduced and broken so notice the coconut oil has

started to break along the edges that's your 
cue to add the shallots if you're using canned

coconut milk sometimes it doesn't split quite like 
that that's okay just reduce it until it's thick

and then keep going with the recipe so after 
just about a minute and the shallots start to

soften I'm going to add my ground pork if you 
don't eat pork you can also do chicken you can

also do crumbled tofu if you want to make this 
vegetarian and now really quickly break up the

pieces the ones your pork is no longer in big 
clumps I'm gonna add the rest of my coconut

milk something about the smell of shallots and 
coconut milk it's so so good now I'm going to

add all my seasoning palm sugar so I've got some 
finely chopped while not finely chopped coarsely

chopped palm sugar here to have plenty of time 
to dissolve and tamarind so this is going to be

sort of a sweet and sour sauce so palm sugar and 
Tamron see those are already similar to pad thai

right in terms of flavor now the salty this is 
where it differs from pad thai Pattaya uses fish

sauce but in this recipe and you think they'll do 
and thoughtyou is fermented soy bean and I've just

mashed it with my fork so to break up the soybeans 
a little bit but this is sort of like our miso if

you don't have it you can substitute me so instead 
I like to add a little bit of sriracha to it it

brightens up the color a little bit and adds a 
little kick just subtle you know you don't want

the super super spicy there you go so now I'm 
going to let this simmer and reduce until thick

it won't take very long so the sauce has been 
reducing for about maybe seven minutes but I'm

going to add one last thing and that is pressed 
tofu and it's just tofu that's very firm so it

won't break even if you toss it around it's got 
texture of maybe cheddar cheese it's that firm so

it's perfect for this kind of thing I'm going to 
toss it in and I'll let the tofu simmer with the

sauce for just one more minute so the tofu absorb 
some of that flavor all right so I'm going to add

some shrimp but this is completely optional 
so if you want to serve this to guess and you

want it to look a little more impressive a few 
shrimp thrown into the sauce will do the trick

and the shrimp will take 30 more seconds to cook 
and then the sauce is done so now what I'm going

to do is I'm going to make shredded omelet so 
I'm going to make a very thin omelet almost

like a crepe and then shred it up and that'll 
get sprinkled on top it's a very iconic look

let's deal with the me part of me catty so send 
me is thin thin rice noodles now these come dry

available at any Asian grocery store soak 
them in room-temperature water for 5 minutes

and then I drain them and then they're soft and 
pliable just like this now Mika Tita noodles are

typically tinted pink and people use different 
things to achieve that colour and I'm not really

sure what's the original pink colour some people 
use ketchup some people use yet the full sauce

remember the pink noodle soup that I use at 
that sauce so I'm going to show you sort of

my own version it's simple its quick and I use red 
bean curd so this is the same bean curd that I use

in my Yenta full video so if you want a refresher 
on what this is you can check out that video I'll

put the link right up here and it comes in a jar 
like this and you can get it at Chinese grocery

stores so this is a type of fermented soy and 
it's got an interesting aroma but once we put

it together with everything else it'll be very 
mild you won't really taste it mash the curd with

my fork and it's very very soft so it's very easy 
to do so my wok is not on yet and then here's the

guitar coconut milk and it'll help sort of enrich 
the noodles because we're not adding any oil to

the noodles all the fat is coming from the coconut 
milk see the pink color is coming through already

right and those little lumps they'll go away I'm 
going to season it a little bit with some vinegar

for some tartness and a touch of sugar now a lot 
of people I'll tell you this just use ketchup so

you you're feeling lazy or you can't find one of 
these you can just use ketchup and coconut milk

and I'm going to also dilute it a little bit with 
some water because I find the commercial coconut

milk is quite rich and it makes the noodles 
a little too rich for my liking alright going

to bring this to a boil okay so now that it's 
boiling like this the noodles are going to go

in and then and yes it looked like a lot of liquid 
right now don't worry the noodles soak it all up

beautiful see it's all absorbed and these noodles 
don't actually mush as easily as you might think

even though they're quite thin okay I'm going 
to finish these off with some vegetables this

is actually what's going to make this smell 
kind of like peptide garlic chives and bean

sprouts going in give it a quick toss and off 
the heat now actually very nice and the noodles

will be mild tasting because remember we've got 
all that rich coconut sauce going on top and

that is it we're ready to assemble and when 
you serve me cat heat you want to serve the

sauce separately because you want the guests to 
do the honor of pouring the sauce on the noodles

the pink noodles I just love that color look 
at that the bean sprouts and the garlic chives

really help lighten the dish up so put a lot in 
okay there's not really too much bean sprouts

or garlic chives and I'm actually going to put 
some extra and yes in Thailand people can just

like me I'm yum yum on it like a bunny that's 
okay to do the sauce is rich you want that lime

that fresh citrusy tartness to cut the grease 
remember the eggs yes I always want to put a

little bit of roasted chili flakes on the side 
there's quite a rich dish and if you don't have

any spicy at all you know it's kind of mmm but 
you when you add that little extra bit of spice

it's just woo you know suddenly it's a lot of 
fun to eat than you it doesn't feel as heavy so

as much as you can tolerate it doesn't have to 
be super spicy look at that that is mica teeth

this is food fit for the Royals right here I 
wish you could smell it oh it smells so good

squeeze a lime and some of that Chili's give 
it a toss and you don't need a lot of sauce

you just need enough to moisten the noodles want 
to make sure I get some tofu in there some egg

mmm sweet-and-sour creamy and rich yet that 
richness is balanced by the spiciness and

the tart lime juice and the crunchy bean sprouts 
and the tofu I love how the tofu actually absorbs

quite a bit of that flavor it is so good like 
I've completely forgotten how good this is it's

been a while in my head I kind of felt like this 
is a lot of work but it really isn't especially

if you get a chance to make a sauce in advance 
the noodles are really quick right oh so good

I hope you give this a try and it's so pretty 
what a great way to serve special guests right

or even if that special guest is just you so 
I hope you give it a try the recipe will be on

hot Thai kitchen calm when you make it send 
me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram

and I will see you next time for your next 
delicious Thai meal the words dead meat is

redundant because meat is clearly already bit 
but no I hadn't really thought about it so

you're dead meat Wow you mean just me your
